stories.text:
My Mac Mini 2014 is getting pretty old and slowing down, and it's time to decide whether to get a new Mac Mini, or abandon Apple as a platform.

There have been some serious accusations made against Apple infringing on user privacy, and essentially snooping and collecting all usage data, and I mean ALL.

My question to the community is: do you believe that these accusations are mere click-bait, or do you think that they hold water - that Apple has gone full 1984 and are attempting to construct a massive surveillance network that spies on everything you do on their computers and other devices?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does Apple Spy on Everything You Do on Its Devices?
UK science stuck in 'holding pattern' on EU funding by Brexit, says minister
